# Show as few data as possible, in weird ways

## DDI

- [Tufte](https://www.edwardtufte.com/tufte/) (famous data viz person) defines the "data density index" (ddi) as "the number of numbers plotted per square inch." 
- In order to make a bad plot, you want to strive for a ddi that is _as low as possible_.
    - $\text{ddi}=1$: novice
    - $\text{ddi}=.5$: intermediate
    - $\text{ddi}=.1$: elite-level, or first-year art student
    - $\text{ddi}>20$: risks making good plot
    
## High ddi
![excess deaths](images/excess_deaths.png)
    

## Low ddi

![image11.png](images/image10.png)

There are six numbers plotted in a $6\times 5 \text{in}$ graphic, so $\text{ddi}=.2\, \text{numbers}/\text{in}^2$.

## Make it better

```{webr}
df <- tribble(
    ~year, ~jp_pct,
    1967,  .44,
    1972,  .623,
    1977, .70
)
```

## It's a stretch

![neck vis](images/neck.jpg)

## Make it better
```{webr}
df <- tribble(
    ~team,        ~earnings,
    "Giants",     1375000,
    "Jaguars",    1280232, 
    "Raiders",    1865525,
    "Cardinals",  5000000,
    "Bears",      18500000,
    "Buccaneers", 3946782,
)
```

# Trick the eye

- Mess with the scale.
- Represent smaller numbers using larger objects, and vice versa.
- Represent lengths by area.
  
## A giant amongst women

![image6.png](images/image4.png)

## Make it better

```{webr}
tribble(
    ~country, ~height,
    "Latvia", "5'5",
    "Australia", "5'4",
    "Scotland", "5'4",
    "Peru", "5'4",
    "South Africa", "5'2",
    "India", "5'0"
)
```

## Popstars

![popstars](images/popstars.jpeg)

## Make it better
```{webr}
df <- tribble(
  ~name,           ~height_m,
  "Nicki Minaj",   1.54,
  "Kylie Minogue", 1.55,
  "Lady Gaga",     1.55,
  "Ariana Grande", 1.57,
  "Rihanna",       1.73,
  "Katy Perry",    1.73,
  "Taylor Swift",  1.80,
  "Iggy Azalea",   1.82
)
```

## Carter vs. Everyone

![image16.png](images/image14.png)

## Make it better

```{webr}
df <- tribble(
    ~year, ~president, ~ppower,
    1958,  "Eisenhower", 1.0,
    1963, "Kennedy", .94,
    1968, "Johnson", .83,
    1973, "Nixon", .64,
    1975, "Ford", .60,
    1978, "Carter", .44
)
```
